conclusion: Calculate the electric field strength at point A due to charges 2q and -q.
The cube has a side length L, charges 2q and -q are at two vertices, point A is another vertex, and midpoint O is on the line connecting 2q and -q.
Electric field due to a point charge Q at distance r is E = k|Q|/r^2.
Distance between 2q and A is diagonal of a face of the cube: r_{2qA} = sqrt(2)L.
Distance between -q and A is the space diagonal of the cube: r_{-qA} = sqrt(3)L.
Electric field at A is the vector sum of fields due to 2q and -q.
Magnitude of electric field at A due to 2q is E_{2q} = k(2q)/(2L^2).
Magnitude of electric field at A due to -q is E_{-q} = kq/(3L^2).
Field due to 2q points away from 2q, field due to -q points toward -q.
Resolve E_{2q} into components: E_{2q,x} = k(2q)/(2sqrt(2)L^2), E_{2q,y} = k(2q)/(2sqrt(2)L^2).
Resolve E_{-q} into components: E_{-q,x} = kq/(3sqrt(3)L^2), E_{-q,y} = kq/(3sqrt(3)L^2), E_{-q,z} = kq/(3sqrt(3)L^2).
